entries.title: Musk testifies in fraud trial, points out that not everyone believes what he says
entries.description: Musk denies impact on Tesla stock price in case over false "funding secured" tweet.

entries.title: US school runs lights 24/7/365: The smart lights have been broken since 2021
entries.description: "We've been doing everything we can to fix this," says school official.

entries.title: 300+ models of MSI motherboards have Secure Boot turned off. Is yours affected?
entries.description: The shortcoming has left users susceptible to malicious bootloaders for 18 months.

entries.title: FTC: Shkreli may have violated lifetime pharma ban, should be held in contempt
entries.description: Shkreli's latest company, Druglike, may run afoul of his lifetime pharma ban.

entries.title: Supreme Court allows Reddit mods to anonymously defend Section 230
entries.description: Mods tell SCOTUS that Reddit's special formula depends on Section 230 immunity.

entries.title: Google cuts 12,000 jobs, the largest layoff in the company’s history
entries.description: Google will slash 12,000 jobs, or about 6 percent of the company.

entries.title: Gonorrhea is becoming unstoppable; highly resistant cases found in US
entries.description: It has resistance or reduced susceptibility to all drugs recommended for treatment.

entries.title: Twitter hired experts for case against Musk—now Musk won’t pay them, lawsuit says
entries.description: Company says it wasn't paid for work on lawsuit that forced Musk to complete merger.

entries.title: D&D maker still wants to revoke earlier versions of “open” gaming license
entries.description: Core rules would go under Creative Commons, "hateful" content would be barred.

entries.title: Twitter retroactively changes developer agreement to ban third-party clients
entries.description: A single line, changed days after a vague statement, ends a foundational era.

entries.title: Musk oversaw staged Tesla self-driving video, emails show
entries.description: Emails show Musk wanted an aspirational—not actual—demo of Full Self-Driving.

entries.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX reaches ‘ludicrous’ cadence; ABL explains RS1 failure
entries.description: "This evidence suggests that an unwanted fire spread to our avionics system."

entries.title: Pioneering Apple Lisa goes “open source” thanks to Computer History Museum
entries.description: Lisa OS 3.1's 1984 source Pascal code now available under a non-commercial license.

entries.title: Hacker group incorporates DNS hijacking into its malicious website campaign
entries.description: The DNS hijacking threat can be especially high for people using public Wi-Fi.
